channel.title: CyberNetSec - Policy and Compliance
channel.description: Latest policy and compliance threat intelligence - the last 10 articles

item.title: Swedish IT Firm Breach Exposes Data of 1.5 Million, Sparks GDPR Probe
item.description:
The Swedish IT services firm Miljödata has suffered a severe data breach, exposing the personal and potentially sensitive information of over 1.5 million people. The incident, which occurred in late August, resulted in the stolen data being published on the darknet. In response, the Swedish Data Pro...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Regulatory, Policy and Compliance

Read Full Article →

item.title: Identity is the New Perimeter: Stolen Credentials and Over-Privileged Accounts Drive Cloud Breaches
item.description:
A consensus is forming across the cybersecurity industry: identity is the new security perimeter in the cloud. New reports from ReliaQuest and Amazon Web Services (AWS) reveal that identity-based attacks are the leading driver of cloud security incidents. Key findings show that compromised credentia...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Cloud Security, Security Operations, Policy and Compliance

item.title: EU Stress-Tests Cyber Defenses in Large-Scale Crisis Simulation
item.description:
The European Union has concluded its 2025 'Blueprint Operational Level Exercise' (BlueOLEx), a large-scale simulation designed to test and improve the bloc's collective response to major cybersecurity crises. Hosted in Cyprus with support from the EU's cybersecurity agency, ENISA, the exercise broug...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Security Operations

item.title: Philippine Police Brace for Coordinated DDoS Attacks on Government Websites
item.description:
The Philippine National Police (PNP) has mobilized its cybersecurity units and placed them on high alert in anticipation of a potential large-scale distributed denial-of-service (DDoS) campaign targeting government websites. According to intelligence, the attacks are slated to begin on November 5, 2...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Cyberattack, Security Operations, Policy and Compliance

item.title: US Cyber Threat Sharing Law 'CISA 2015' Expires, Creating Potential Intelligence Gap
item.description:
The Cybersecurity Information Sharing Act of 2015 (CISA 2015), a foundational U.S. law that provided liability protections to encourage private companies to share cyber threat data with the government, expired on October 1, 2025. Amidst a government shutdown and a block by Senator Rand Paul, lawmake...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Threat Intelligence

Read Full Article →

item.title: China Amends Cybersecurity Law, Massively Increasing Fines and Adding AI Governance Clause
item.description:
China has passed major amendments to its 2016 Cybersecurity Law, set to take effect on January 1, 2026. The changes dramatically increase financial penalties for non-compliance, raising the maximum fine for Critical Information Infrastructure Operators (CIIOs) tenfold to RMB 10 million (approx. $1.4...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory

item.title: T-Mobile Enters Credit Card Market with Capital One, Raising Data Security Questions
item.description:
T-Mobile announced its entry into the financial services sector with the launch of its first-ever credit card, created in partnership with banking giant Capital One. This strategic move will leverage T-Mobile's vast customer base and Capital One's financial infrastructure. The partnership introduces...

item.title: Canada Issues National Alert as Hacktivists Target Critical Infrastructure
item.description:
The Canadian Centre for Cyber Security, along with the RCMP, has issued a national alert warning of increasing cyberattacks by hacktivists against the nation's critical infrastructure. The advisory follows multiple successful breaches of internet-accessible Industrial Control Systems (ICS) in sector...

Severity: High

Categories: Industrial Control Systems, Policy and Compliance, Cyberattack

item.title: Massive 70TB Data Leak at Tata Motors from Exposed AWS Keys
item.description:
A colossal security failure at Tata Motors has resulted in the exposure of over 70 terabytes of sensitive corporate data, customer information, and infrastructure details. The breach, which was first identified in 2023, stemmed from multiple critical misconfigurations, including plaintext Amazon Web...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Cloud Security, Policy and Compliance

item.title: U.S. Coast Guard Poised for 'Generational Change' in Maritime Cybersecurity with $25B Funding
item.description:
The U.S. Coast Guard (USCG) is set for a 'generational change' in maritime cybersecurity, according to an analysis by the Center for Strategic and International Studies (CSIS).
